SEARCH
Package org.thamindu.realtimeticketing.model

Class Vendor

java.lang.Object
org.thamindu.realtimeticketing.model.Vendor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Vendor extends Object implements Runnable
Represents a Vendor in the ticketing system. A Vendor is responsible for releasing tickets to the TicketPool at a specified rate.

This class is designed to be thread-safe and implements the Runnable interface to allow concurrent execution of multiple vendors. The use of threads ensures scalability for handling multiple ticket release operations.

    • isRunning

      public volatile boolean isRunning
      A volatile flag to safely manage the running state of the Vendor thread. Volatile ensures visibility of changes across threads.

  • Constructor Details

    • Vendor

      public Vendor(String vendorId, int ticketsReleaseRate, TicketPool ticketPool)
      Constructs a Vendor with the specified ID, ticket release rate, and ticket pool.
      Parameters:
      vendorId - the unique identifier for the vendor
      ticketsReleaseRate - the rate at which the vendor releases tickets
      ticketPool - the ticket pool to which the vendor releases tickets
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the ticket release rate is not positive

  • Method Details

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the vendor from releasing tickets by setting the running flag to false.

      This method is thread-safe due to the use of the volatile variable isRunning.

    • run

      public void run()
      Runs the vendor, releasing tickets to the ticket pool at the specified rate. The vendor stops running if interrupted or if the ticket pool is full.

      This method ensures that ticket additions respect the ticket pool's capacity and handles thread interruptions gracefully to avoid resource leaks.

      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
